dmca.title: [ABUSE] Illigal Software and Hotlinking, Continued Complaint]
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: abuseadm@theplanet.com [mailto:abuseadm@theplanet.com] On Behalf
Of The Planet Policy Enforcement
Posted At: Sunday, May 07, 2006 7:51 PM
Posted To: Copyright
Conversation: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Illigal Software and Hotlinking, Continued
Complaint]
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Illigal Software and Hotlinking, Continued
Complaint]


-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at
the address of copyright@theplanet.com.

- -------- Original Message --------
Subject:         [ABUSE] Illigal Software and Hotlinking, Continued
Complaint
Date:         Sat, 6 May 2006 22:44:37 -0600
From:         <legal@firstclasshosting.net>
To:         <copyright@theplanet.com>, <abuse@theplanet.com>,
<legal-response@theplanet.com>, "InvisionFree"
<invfree@invisionfree.com>, <legal@invisionfree.com>,
<abuse@invisionfree.com>, <webmaster@invisionfree.com>



We have contacted the Site administrator and register as stated in the
who is directory information regarding this issue. You are hosting a
account with the domain name. http://invisionfree.com/, They provide
free forums etc for everything from chat to gaming forums. They are
hosting a site for free located at this url
http://s15.invisionfree.com/ThePlace/ This free forum hosted by this
user is hotlinking to files on our servers, as well as providing several
program that are "cracked" Only one of the files they was hosting we are
authorized to delegate but there are many others who we are making aware
of the theft. The one file we are authorized to delegate is known as
D2jsp. It is a pay for program that requires a key to activate. The
authors site is located at www.d2jsp.org <http://www.d2jsp.org> This
site http://s15.invisionfree.com/ThePlace
<http://s15.invisionfree.com/ThePlace/> is providing the download as
well as a .dll file that has been rewritten to bypass the security
features in the program. We would provide the urls for the hotlinking
files but the board administrator has banned or investigation accounts
as well as blocked standard browsing of the forum. We contacted the free
forum board administrator as well as the administrator for invision free
at invfree@invisionfree.com <mailto:invfree@invisionfree.com> and have
seen no action. We are writing you at copyright@theplanet.com
<mailto:copyright@theplanet.com> so maybe we can get this issue
resolved. This forum is also hosting many files that just providing for
download violates our sister companies Terms of Service known as
Blizzard Entertainment or Blizzard North a Subsidiary of  Vivendi
Universal Games. We are asking this issue be resolved among the
companies that are involved but we may be required to escalate this
issue further. With in 2 weeks your cooperation as well as the owner of
www.invisionfree.com <http://www.invisionfree.com> will be receiving
certified letters regarding this issue to the following addresses.

Invisionfree.com Administrative contact
Brandon Kopetzky
Zathyus Networks, Inc.
P.O Box 1763
Bowie, MD  20721-1763

Copyright Notifications
George Poletes
Corporate Counsel
1333 Stemmons Freeway, Suite 110,
Dallas, TX 75207

We thank you for your time and expect your timely and delayed response
to this problem.

First Class Hosting
Blizzard North Entertainment

- --
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/aup.html
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v1.4.2 (MingW32)
Comment: Using GnuPG with Mozilla - http://enigmail.mozdev.org

iD8DBQFEXpYMvK/XpJs6oyURAg/NAJ0Q+a2lq0bKhWaUne3nbv+2Yr+oLACfaS5v
URJ1Mj0p0nKI/N+3P1LDNZ8=
=fO3X
-----END PGP SIGNATURE-----
